thread.title: Twins share genes and love of the Royals
thread.title_full: Twins share genes and love of the Royals

author: Laura McCallister
title: Twins share genes and love of the Royals
text:
Twins share genes and love of the Royals Posted: brad.stephens@kctv5.com KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - 
Royals fans come in all ages and sizes and that includes a pair of twins united by their love of the team. 
They are a very enthusiastic Gene Winters and his towel waving, shy, twin sister Gina Harvey. 
Even a little batting practice on an off day brings out the best in Winters, including moose antlers and a call of the wild. He’s got lines for almost every player. 
"All aboard the Cain Train, Woo-W ,” he shouts. 
Winters has the hardware to back it up. 
“Got the cane from Louisville Slugger, got my name on it. But I actually named it. You know what its name is? Lorenzo," he said. 
That’s just the tip of the blue iceberg. In his home/museum, you’ll find Royals hats, socks, shoes, baseball cards, dolls and memorabilia to help remember the greatness of his hometown team. 
Harvey knows how it started for her. 
“In 2009, my mom passed away and a couple weeks later my older brother passed away,” she said. 
Then Winters had major back operations and needed help getting to Kauffman Stadium. The siblings grew closer and learned to love the Royals even more. 
If the Royals can’t take the crown this year, the siblings can always dream about next season. 
“Bring on October, bring on November. We're ready for it all," Winters shouts.
